p: Although RA is available in a diverse range of forms, dried roots and traditional Chinese decoction pieces are still the main consumables. The price varies with quality, and is consistent with the size and active ingredients. The Chinese Pharmacopoeia ( CPC, 2015) gives the standards for the quality control of RA. In addition to public standards, there are also a number of different private market standards and these can be broadly divided into four grades. Commonly, based on size, different prices are often found for RA that is “small” (0.35–0.8 cm), “medium” (0.8–1.2 cm), “large” (>1.2 cm), and “huge” (>1.5 cm), as illustrated in Figure 3.
